flawed_nl_solution:
Twice Jill's age is 2*20=<<2*20=40>>40
If Roger's age is 5 more than twice Jill's age, he is 5+40=54 years old.
In 15 years, Jill will be 20+15=<<20+15=35>>35 years old.
Roger's age will be 54+15=<<54+15=69>>69 years old in 15 years.
The age difference between Roger and Jill in fifteen years will be 69-35=<<69-35=34>>34 years
In 15 years, the age difference between Roger and Jill will be 30 years less than Finley's age, meaning in fifteen years Finley will be 30+34=<<30+34=64>>64 years old.
Currently, Finley is 64-15=<<64-15=49>>49 years old.
#### 49

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 45, not 54. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
